list.name: illustrator
list.description: Master a fair part of Illustrator features and having designed the most of my promotional materials with the tool.

list.name: photoshop
list.description: Developed skills using various of the tools offered by Photoshop and honed up my ability for image refinement and graphic visuals.

list.name: MySQL Workbench
list.description: Worked my way around the basics of MYSQL databases and have the ability to manipulate data and alter, create or drop tables and using sql commands.

list.name: unity
list.description: Have hands-on experience with simple games developed in college course. Worked with Java scripts for functionalities as well.

list.name: github
list.description: This version control tool does not hold many secrets from me. Pulls, pushes and commits are practices part of my projects development routine. On top of that, I have practiced CI method using GitHub Actions.

list.name: visual studio
list.description: Ever since I started coding, Visual Studio has always been the IDE that I construct my projects on for its ease of use and wide range of services.

list.name: android studio
list.description: Having built few apps for coursework in Java and one app soon to be in production with Flutter, Android Studio is my ideal sidekick when working on mobile projects.

list.name: ibm cloud
list.description: It is the first cloud service provider that helped me familiarize with cloud-native applications and AI services such as Watson Assistant, Natural Language Understanding, Language Translator...
